text: Great food and service. Always consistent with the quality. My must haves are the cucumber salad and fried shrimp spring rolls. The blue flame and rainbow roll are really good. And the red bean ice cream is SO good! And the happy hour deals are great.

After having our first date at Akai Hana Sushi we were amazingly pleased with our service and the quality of our food.  Being creatures of habit we chose to revisit the restaurant for our Anniversary yesterday and the service was much less than what we had come to expect from Akai Hana.  Our server, Kevin, was polite and forgot to bring us plates, napkins and our drink refills.  After canceling our second round of beverages we left.  I attempted to call and speak with a manager or owner and was hung up on.  I am sad to say that we will not be revisiting the location of our FIRST DATE and truly hope they can work out the details to make their restaurant as good as it was before.

We have been coming to this place for about 15 years. They just keep getting better and better and with this new remodel it has opened it up so much and I love it!  Their food is always fresh, they are always adding new menu items but rest assured the old ones are still there and if they aren't, they will make it for you anyway! Do yourself a favor and check it out!

Great sushi! Great happy hour! Fast service even when busy! Ask for there white sesame salad dressing to dip your sushi in! Hooked! Love this place :) only thing is it gets a little loud when it's a little busy but it's worth it. For the 4pm-close happy hour it's a great time to try new rolls, huge menu!

I work nearby and eat lunch here on a semi-weekly basis. For the price the sushi is quite good. They have a "happy hour" menu for lunch with great prices on good rolls. Their specialty rolls are excellent and have some interesting combinations.  The building Mr. Sushi is in screams "hole in the wall" but don't be put off by it.  Service speed can be a bit spotty when it is busy but the wait is worth it in my opinion.

Picked up food here today for my moms birthday.  We loved it.  Got the fried veggies, edamame, rice, salad, and avocado sushi   An abundance of food for a great price. Literally ate my heart out and I'm about to take an amazing nap. Definitely a bang for your buck for happy hour 11am-2pm

I recently took a position with a company close to Akaihana and decided to check it out for lunch.   What I found was an interior under moderate renovation which left the ambiance rather concerning.  With bare walls and raw sheet rock I considered cleanliness.  I sat at the bar and received moderately hasty service during a busy lunch rush.  What I ordered:  Cucumber salad, which was clunky and entirely too much for an appetizer salad.  It resembled veggie spaghetti which was difficult to eat without worry.  The flavor was flat.  Fresh Oysters, delightful yet small.  Both appetizers were served AFTER my Nigiri order of Unagi, Salmon and Yellowtail.  All 3 orders of Nigiri were delicate and fresh.  Exactly what you would expect from raw fish albeit they were served on WARM sushi rice.   Overall, the potential for a great experience is there!  Will I return, yes!   Next up: Hamachi Kama ( which is another of my gauges of Great Japanese cuisine.) Cost out the door for lunch with tea- $30.00 - but I did splurge!
Average sushi here, pretty good lunch specials.  Nothing to write home about but if you are hungry and in the area, its a decent meal.  Prices are mid to high for sushi.  Come in, eat, get out...
Awesome specials and family friendly. Very busy place! Tempura and wasabi salad dressing were delightful. Reasonable prices and great dinner specials. We'll be back soon.   Delightful dinner.

My daughter's friends have been raving about this place and I have been meaning to check it out, but I first started eating sushi here in Phoenix at Takamatsu, so I was kind of a snob.  Let me tell you, I am no longer snobbish!  We went for HH and since I had a large lunch, I wasn't too terribly hungry.  I decided to try their Pacific Oysters (@ 3 for $6.00) pretty good deal.  I had only been used to East Coast Oysters so I had nothing to compare to.  If you are used to East Coast Oysters, go to Akaihana anytime and try their Pacific Oysters.  Beware though, 1 oyster is as big as your face!!!  Definitely worth the 3 for $6.00. Each oyster was crisp, clean and meaty!  Very sweet and the mignionette sauce was divine!!!  I ordered a 1/2 dozen, which was by far too much, but I happily ate them anyway and just didn't have to have dinner.  The sake bomber price was ok but at Stingray Sushi it is cheaper (by $2.00).  I am going to go back  and try their sushi during happy hour and hope to come away pleasantly surprised!!!

Akaihana is one of my favorite go-to restaurants for date night! The service is always good and the restaurant has a great mom-and-pop vibe. There are pictures of customers covering the walls; they're pictures that were taken when the customers celebrated a special occasion at the restaurant (think birthdays, anniversaries, etc.) My favorite menu items are the blue flame and jalapeño poppers, so delicious! I've taken my family to the restaurant as well and my sister ordered a bowl of noodles, she loved it! I recommend going during happy hour and at lunch time to get the most out of your experience. I cannot recommend Akaihana enough!

If you like to save money, the happy hour prices at Akaihana also simply known as "Mr. Sushi" are ridiculously cheap. The quality of food and the atmosphere is homely when entering the restaurant.   There are different varieties of sushies available to all the sushi lovers. This place is great for all the college students who live nearby. It's a great access to get away from campus and have lunch with your peers.
Wonderful remodel, food is still unbelievable the best in the valley, If you looking for great sushi come here

This place was recommended by 2 friends when it was called Mr. Sushi.  My wife and I met up with another couple here for dinner this week.  When we walked in, the person working the host/hostess booth asked one of the server's to seat us and she responded with attitude.  This pretty much set the tone for the rest of the evening.  1.  Wife's beverage didn't make it out until after 20 minutes of being seated and after 3 requests.  2.  It was hit or miss with some of the rolls we ordered.  The California Roll fell apart when trying to eat it with chop sticks.  The crab mix tasted off.  3.  Server didn't clear the table and we sat with finished plates cluttering our table until we paid our bill.  4.  One of our rolls was forgotten about and was brought out to us when everyone finished their sushi and entrees.  Some positives of Akaihana is that the quantity of sushi was plentiful and the price was very reasonable.  Some of the other staff seemed friendly but unfortunately we drew the short straw.  My wife doesn't want to have anything to do with the place but I'm willing to give it another shot sometime down the road.

Great sushi in an odd and easy to miss location. Better than most places in town, reasonably priced and always consistent. Standouts include the crazy roll, baked scallop dynamite rolls and many of the others on both the extensive sushi menu and large Japanese Menu. I consistently to come here out of my way instead of the "fancier" places simply because their food is better.

The food here is absolutely delicious. The only problem is the service. It was just two of us and we ordered the lobster tempura and a bowl or ramen. It took forever for our food to come out and it was sorta sad that once food did come out it was only one order. By the time my boyfriend finished his food and awhile after the other order came. Maybe next time I go it will be better and I can give it a better review. But as I said its food is 5 star quality. It was just the service and time that has me rating it 3 stars
This a family favorite since 2010. Love the blue flame and tootsie roll! The service is wonderful and the staff are very accomodating.
Always great food and service! They also have a good deal on rolls for Happy Hour. Also known as "Mr Sushi" is defintley my favorite sushi place!

This place is a complete joke. My fiancé ordered 4 rolls on the happy hour menu, and I ordered 2 on the regular menu. His rolls were brought out one by one over the course of an hour, and it took over an hour for me to get my first roll. The service is horrific and the sushi is average at best. Will not be back.
Best in Phoenix and it's not even close.  Location leaves a bit to be desired but the food is always excellent, variety unmatched.
Really enjoyed the Sushi here. Went for happy hour. Spicy Tuna Roll, California Roll and the Fried Salmon Roll my favorites

Terrible experience!! I went to Akaihana Sushi this afternoon with couple of friends. It started off terribly when the server didn't even give us the menus and we had to bring them ourselves. Later after we ordered, our starters didn't come until after 40 minutes and we were not given any plates or bowls to eat on. After another hour two rolls of sushi were served. Among three of us it wasn't a lot of food and we were patiently waiting for our order. After 2 hours of waiting the server came with the check not even mentioning our food that was never served. We decided not to wait any longer, pay for what we ate and cancel the rest of the order. It took another 30 minutes for the waitress to split the check in between three of us and figure out the change. It was a big waste of our afternoon- 2.5 hours and still hungry. But the best is at the end! I came home and checked my bank account and I was charged $25 more than what I was billed for!! Tomorrow I have to go and argue with them again. I will not be revisiting that place ever again. I strongly DO NOT recommend it!

I love this place! I found out about  this place from a friend and cant stop going! The cucumber salad is so delicious and i cant find it anywhere else. They have all sorts of yummy rolls:) My personal favorite is the Crazy roll and the Forrest Gump roll.

We went here today for happy hour and was disappointed.   We ordered gyoza, teriyaki chicken, spicy chicken, ramen, baked scallops roll and salmon skin roll.  Gyoza and spicy chicken were the saving grace for me and the family. I will definitely come back just for the spicy chicken.  Teriyaki was nothing special. The ramen, which supposed to have pork and veggies but I only found 2 thin pieces of pork. The worst part was that the broth was barely warm and lacked flavor.   The salmon skin roll was ok. It was falling apart! The baked scallop roll was just mostly imitation crab with mayo and some scallops. The baked scallop roll took about 15-20 mins before we got it.  Anyway, the service was ok, the food was so disappointing especially for the price.

Okay so this is my second time calling for a takeout and they still SCREW UP MY ORDER.  It's so annoying how I called and told them to please not mess up my order for the second time and they did. I called at 3pm to have it ready by 5pm! This is ridiculous, and their staff has an attitude & clearly doesn't know how to do their job. The sushi is good though, just crappy service!!!

I've been coming here for over 20 years as my favorite sushi spot in the phoenix metropolitian arra. Since the remodel and expansion it has gone down hill. Unless you get Sean or David at the bar. I just took 8 friends from out of town and was very disappointed. They need better table service and management.

This is an updated review for me. Lately, I have found the experience at Akaihana to be inconsistent. Sometimes it's great, other times, it's poor.   In general, service is better at the bar (and you still may wait there awhile, too). --All too often one must flag down a waitress or waiter for things from the kitchen. Of late, the wait staff don't look towards the diners ---you really have to wave and call out. If you just wave, they will walk past you. --  Sushi/sashimi presentation varies per chef. The younger male chef is consistently more careful and artful with his creations. The older male chef can be careless at times --creating messy and disappointing dishes.  Sometimes the same sauces seem to taste better than at other times. I had a poorer "taste" experience on the weekend compared to during the week. Maybe I got the dregs of the sauce --when workers were too busy to make a fresh batch...  All in all, I'm ready to explore new options.

Don't order the AZ Cards Roll. It didn't come out as advertised and they were unwilling to make any resolutions except a lot of conflicting excuses. Rice and ginger were dry too. Very disappointed. Won't be back.

I've been going her off and on for abour 10 years myself, mostly because it's 2 miles from my front door. What can I say? My overall take on this place is it's a bit pricey for what they deliver, the service is mediocre to good, the chefs only semi-helpful. Food quality generally quite good, although I have noted some sloppy preparation lately. I've taken to ordering the catering special Samurai Platter lately to go, 7 rolls for $35. This is probably their best value, but last time the rolls fell apart and the tuna was kind of mushy. Still, they have the best caterpillar roll I've ever had. Guess I'd recommend this one with some cautions.
Absolutely perfect. Clean,fast delicious. Extremely satisfied everytime. All fish fresh and sweet. Ive been going here for years and not once left hungry or not satisfied. Better than sex

So, I was a little nervous about trying a Sushi place in AZ. I wasn't sure how fresh fish could be since the state is mostly desert...  However, I'm happy to say I was pleasantly surprised. I had read a lot of the previous reviews including some really horrible ones, but decided that those seemed few and far between.  The reason for 4 stars instead of 5 is the slow service. All the servers were very friendly and helpful, but it was a little slow to get just about anything.  We ordered shumai appitizer, miso soup and four rolls. The Blue Flame roll was my husbands favorite, its fried, but lightly so it doesn't have a lot of crunch which we both really enjoyed. We also ordered a dragon roll, Jan roll and baked scallop roll. All the rolls were good, fresh and presented well. And considering the price, its a great value.  I will definitely eat here again next time I'm in Phoenix.

Let me start with saying that the sushi here was wonderful! That's the only reason it gets four stars. You could tell the wait staff was working their butts off but there were definitely NOT enough of them. We sat at the sushi bar as there were no tables available. A waitress took our drink orders and we asked for a regular dinner menu as one of us was not eating sushi. Not once did anyone come back to take the order, refill drinks etc. Phone was ringing off the hook with no one answering. We will definitely eat here again but might just get food to go. I've worked in the F&B industry for years so I understand how crazy things can get but they definitely need a manager, hostess and maybe a busser or two to help with the dinner rush. Doesn't seem like they are handling the expansion very well.
Some of the best sushi I've had here in the states. I have been by this wonderful spot many times and wondered if the what turned out to be excellent Japanese cuisine was true.

Some friends took me here recently and I couldn't thank them enough. We got their right when it opened and had an attentive server who checked up on us after every dish was brought out. We spent a lot of time deciding what to order and ended up ordering more. Now, even with the awesome deals for happy hour, we still spent quite a lot for four people. Definitely some of the best authentic sushi in the area with a peaceful atmosphere that you can really enjoy with some great friends.

Normally this place is the best sushi in town, but I'm guessing the new remodel means crappier sushi, no sushi, and lack of quality. Hopefully they can go back to the older ways of caring about special orders

Darkly tucked into a corner of the strip mall, this is a really great place once you find it.  Affordable, very good flavor, large rolls.  You get much more than you pay for here.  We had the Las Vegas roll, Spicy Tuna, and Six Shooter.  All were very good.  We would return any time.  My only suggestion is to light up the sign so it is easier to find.  We almost gave up before seeing the "OPEN" sign.  VERY happy that we stopped by.

Found this place on Yelp. This place has delicious sushi.  The rolls and hand rolls are a really good size.  I liked the salmon, albacore and octopus, which I always get. Also the spicy tuna and salmon skin hand rolls were very good.  I did order the Baja roll but found out that I don't like garlic ponzu sauce. If you are a cheesecake lover I HIGHLY recommend having their deep fried cheesecake. I had never had cheesecake like that. It was Awesome!!!! I will definitely go back! Love!!!

If you are looking for good sushi, pay attention to the negative reviews.  I should have because everything they said was accurate.   Our food took 45 minutes to arrive for three rolls and a noodle soup.   We had: Manhattan Roll, Spicy Tuna Roll, Sunset Roll and the Nabeyaki Udon.   Overall the food is not good. Fairly bland, slightly hard rice that is the wrong kind of sticky.  The salmon is not pink, but that odd light orange color of not so good fish. The rolls are haphazardly rolled, the interior shape squashed and oblong.  Inconsistent piece by piece.  I will not return.  It was not worth the time or money.   If you want decent sushi check out Yen.    Sunset Roll: The fish is sliced messy, no care for details was taken, and placed over the roll in a sloppy hastened manner. The lemon that is placed on top also inconsistently cut, randomly sized and shaped.  The rind was left on the lemon.  Unpleasant. The salmon as I mentioned above, was not good.   Manhattan Roll:  Was only passable because the shrimp was deep fried and it had sauces with flavor. Same rice and shape problems.   Spicy Tuna:  not good.  The tuna was too light a shade of pink. Bland in flavor, and made too spicy to make up for lack of taste.  Shape and rice problems.   Udon: Bland, flavorless. Needed basic things like salt. Was not hot, just somewhat warm upon arrival. The tempura shrimp accompanying it was also bland.   Odd dirty drawings of sushi rolls on the walls drawn using markers and crayons. I thought they were children's drawings at first.

My husband and I are not necessarily sushi people, but we tried the sushi rolls here and they were delicious. Not realizing how much food we were ordering, we got the blue flame, Philadelphia and Tokyo rolls along with Beef Tataki. It was way too much food for 2 people. It was all excellent, especially the Beef Tataki.   We came on our lunch break, and the place was busy, but wait times were reasonable. Service was very friendly. I appreciated the fact that the waitstaff didn't seem territorial at all. If we needed a refill and a server was passing, they just offered a refill. It's refreshing compared to restaurants where your one and only server is overloaded and can't give you the attention you need.  We will definitely return.

After 4 years in the valley, I finally have a go-to sushi place. This place was clean and modern with fast service. I ordered two happy hour rolls, and two specialty rolls. They were all tasty and huge! I can't wait to come back and try more.
Best Hamachi Kama in town. The sushi is delicious.  And the service is exceptional. That's why this is favorite sushi restaurant.

This is our favorite sushi place in town. Big tasty sushi rolls for a very reasonable price. The renovated the place a year or two ago so the ambience is good too. I highly recommend this and the goodyear locations.

Best sushi rolls ever. I have tried many rolls here.  All are fresh and delicious but my favorites are the blue flame roll and the tropicana roll. This is a true hidden gem. They have a happy hour menu that is fantastic. I believe happy hour is twice a day. I always get seated right away, but its always a bit busy. I like to see that so I know fish is fresh. The staff is always nice and friendly. Definitely don't go to the chain sushi restaurants anymore. I pay half the price and get fresher sushi here with a smile.

Awesome experience!  The sushi menu was more than adequate and the rest of the menu options were great.  We came here on a Wed night around 6:15 PM, just missing happy hour.  The place was busy, but the service was still descent.  We ordered two salmon-based rolls (Philadelphia and Las Vegas rolls) and the teriyaki chicken dinner (which was pretty big portion of chicken and a heaping serving of salad).  Great tasting food!  We'll be back soon!

Not one of those loud trendy sushi houses! A hidden gem tucked into an unlikely area. I am a lover of great Japanese food and finding one seems to be a difficult undertaking in the Phoenix area. Akaihana's food is fantastic and reasonably priced. I love to get the Mr. Sushi Bento for lunch. It has everything you could ask for in a bento (including a very fresh price of sashimi tuna) and the quality of the meat is great. This place is not fancy, and you won't be bombarded with the standard high-volume techno drumbeats that most sushi places seem to have; much more traditional here. two thumbs way up!

I absolutely love this place! It has become "our place" for date night. We have dinned here many times and I've never been let down. Delicious no matter what we get, good happy hour and a nice overall vibe in this cozy restaurant. Our service is always exceptional , receiving warm hellos and goodbyes . If you haven't givin it a try you are missing out!
If your hungry, don't go , the service is slow and we had to walk out and go to el pollo loco.  This review isn't even worth writing

I've been to many sushi places over the years but akai Hana is by far the best in the valley. Their sushi is always fresh and have the best happy hour with the most friendly staff. Thanks Sean for always making our visit a great one!!

This place has been very solid for many years. It is our neighborhood secret. The food is really good and prices are low compared to other sushi restaurants. If you know your sushi, you will like this place. The tuna is always, consistently top quality. My wife is Japanese and she really likes this place. It can get really busy and crowded if you go at the wrong time. If so you will have to wait at times but I always call to see how busy it is and get reservations. Some of the best sushi in Phoenix and that is why it is often crowded. Enjoy!

Food is yummy and we come here often. I gave it 5 stars, but I wanted to give them a 10. We always have the fried California roll and teriyaki chicken. The chicken is very good! The best part is that it is very affordable and family friendly.
Small shop that blew the expectations I had through the roof. The sushi nd everything else is amazing and such a great price !!

I'm not a sushi person by no means. However the slightly fried sushi is my favorite because i can eat it and not feel like its just raw fish. The happy hour has some awesome prices. Beer starting at 3.50 even for some of their imports.

Only sushi place we're found in Phoenix that gets repeat business from us. Most are awful, some are decent, but this place is good!  Polite, quick service and tasty sushi! Their appetizers and entrees are also pretty good, though we usually come for the sushi. There are almost too many sushi options, we're slowly working through them.   Do yourself a favor, get the "Nixon Roll". :D

I will no longer dining in or picking up take-out from here. The food quality and service is no longer consistent.  Against my better judgement I did try again silly me don't even think about trying the lobster tempura roll. You wont any lobster literally a spec. This place also thinks putting brown avocado in rolls is ok, I find it disgusting!
Food was good, only reason why not 5 star servers took a while to take order, bring food, refills, and forgot a sushi we ordered. Liked there was no wait time arrived around 3pm on a Sunday.

I'm here once a week.  The staff is great.  The food is better!  Spicy Tuna Cracker app is a winner. Baked scallop roll is a must have.  They have so many different rolls, there is something for everyone. Rice free, low-carb options available as well. ooh!  Get the jalapeno popper app. It's stuffed with crab. Soooo good.

LOVED IT!!!!! I have been coming to this sushi joint for 10 years, the name has changed, but the food has remained AWESOME!!!! Sean & Chris really know how to throw down the SUSHI!!!! I absolutely love their HH and the DRAGON salad is SUBLIME!!! When I think sushi, this is the first place I think of!!!!

Odd location with good food. Pretty much in an empty shopping mall next to I-17. We had a mix of rolls and nigiri.  Albacore: large pieces and fresh  Salmon: large pieces and fresh  Todd Roll: a large amount of spicy tuna on top of a tempura eggpant chip. Quite tasty, but quite a bit of tuna on top.   Lobster Tempura Roll: good sized pieces of lobster. The whole thing is deep fried. Perhaps not your thing  Spicy Yellowtail Roll: a subtle sweetness to it. Definitely worth an order  N*Joy
Best sushi in town. I come here with my family and friends. They are always busy but have fret quality sushi. I highly recommend this place.
This it's my favorite sushi place in the valley. The staff is super friendly and they serve you quickly with a smile .

Pretty amazing sushi experience! The lobster (dynamite or not) is to die for, the Crazy roll is just as good. And their Las Vegas roll is unlike any I ever taste, its spicy jalapenos, spicy sauce, Verde sauce and all. Ive been craving their delicious goodness since I had it a few days ago. The staff caters to your every need and are as friendly as could be, the patrons that hangout here are equally as friendly. Overall the best experience Ive had in a while, though my heart will always be with Sakana (Ahwatukee).
This is the best Sushi Restaurant in Phoenix . The manager Mr. Starve Ogawa Sushi is not looks like Japanese, but he is the Japanese real man of Sushi.

You know those sushi places in strip malls which are the local favorites where you walk in and the sushi chef and his assistant kind of say hello in Japanese but are really half-hearted in their salutations and not all that excited to be there but you sit up at the bar anyway and look at  the options and decide for the sushi special and then you wait a while and you get your miso soup which is a very lazy version of miso soup indeed and then get your sushi order and you proceed to eat a plattter full of sushi but within 30 seconds of finishing you don't remember how anything tasted which is kind of strange and the surly college-student waiter gives you your bill and you put in your credit card but the waiter then decides to ignore you for 10 minutes until the sushi chef gets his attention and then he finally comes and processes your transaction but doesn't say "thank you" when he gives you your receipt to sign and you waver at how much tip to give and you just walk out going, "Well, that was a beige experience if there ever was one"?  Yeah, it was one of those places.

Tried this place out per friend recommendation.  Also known as Mr. Sushi.    Didn't expect to enjoy a sushi place situated next to a major freeway and a motel, but I really do!  I was told to try the Tootsie roll, which was really tasty.  But honestly, I was most impressed by the salmon sashimi.  Very inexpensive for sushi.  Perfect for a meal with friends or a casual date.

Finding a great sushi place in the neighborhood with an amazing happy hour, is like striking gold!!! Love this little place. Its nothing fancy but its everything you could want in a local sushi location. Awesome happy hour with $1 miso soup, and good service. I've been coming here for years and I love taking my friends and family. Never a bad time!

This review is long overdue. I come here at least once a week, and I love it!  We order the tropicana roll, tootsie roll, blue flame, and the spicy tuna or spicy salmon roll. It's delicious every time, without fail. I am never disappointed! The atmosphere is casual, so it's nice to be able to stop in for sushi even if I'm not dressed up.  If you're looking for a sushi place, your search is over!
Six Shooter Roll & Jericho the great roll - It was good and cheap, but not as fresh as it use to be. To me the key to great sushi is really fresh fish.
This is the worst restaurant experience I've ever had! Not only is this place super slow in service but the food was not fresh!
The reverse happy hour is the way to go! The jalapeño poppers are amazing- a must try when you visit. Sushi is okay, but still good. Great and fast service.

Great sushi and price is reasonable. They have multiple menus including a happy hour menu. They have sooooo many different rolls and are not packed with fillers like cream cheese as most average sushi joints do. Service could be better. 4/5 stars.
Happy Hour menu did not have a huge selection but the sushi was delicious and good service!

Ok.. Food was outstanding.. Service needs work..  We sat down, and it took about 10 minutes for a young lady to take our drink order.  We've never been hear  before,  so we didn't know that you had to fill out an order form & give it to someone.  She  finally came back with the drinks, and  took the order form... It was happy hour, and  we took advantage of it.  We ordered some appetizers that should gave come FIRST, but actually came out after the rest of our order.  I had the soft shell shrimp which were fantadtic, but they still had the shell, and  vein on it.. and the heads!!!  I guess they assume that everyone uses chopsticks,  because they never brought any silverware..  And our supposed server never returned.  My husband sat there for 6 or 7 minutes with no fork,  while his hot food was getting cold. A guy was walking by, and  we asked him for a stupid fork..

I love this place. Always smiling and friendly staff. The Sushi is the best in the valley for the price.  Went there again last night after not visiting for 6 or so month... and all I can say is that I do not go to this place enough.  TIP: If you are a lover of sushi rolls with a kick, the Blue Flame is a must.
Food is average. Service a little slow but very nice staff. Busy place, casual atmosphere. On the plus side, the prices are great.

Came here based on Yelp reviews. We got here at happy hour. Our table got $1 miso soup, rainbow roll, blue flame roll, spicy tuna roll, sashimi salad, ramen, and takoyaki. Everything tasted really good. The batter on the outside of the blue flame was a little thicker than I wanted. The fish tasted very good on the rainbow roll. The sashimi salad was perfect for my friend who just really wanted fish. The ramen was a large portion. Our waitress was very attentive. If I was in the area, I wouldn't mind coming back.

This is the only place I eat sushi at. The fish is fresh and sushi is prepared when ordered. Everytime I go, I try something different and have not been disappointed yet. If you are a true seafood and sushi lover you need to come here.
Incredibly fresh considering we are nowhere near the ocean! Great lunch menu and friendly service. We are leaving stuffed and happy.

This is the best sushi joint I've found in all of Arizona. Their happy hour prices and times are excellent and the sushi is made to perfection, there is something for everyone! I recommend the blue flame or the tootsie rolls, but honestly you can't go wrong with so many options available. The restaurant is always clean and the servers are always friendly and efficient, they can be a little hard to understand sometimes but this should be expected at a place so authentic. Plenty of places to park and don't let the outside of the building discourse you as the city is in the process of upgrading and remodeling the shopping center that this restaurant is located in.

We checked this place out for the first time, and man was it awesome. Very clean, very good service, and very tasty. To start with, a very informative menu with lots of pictures of different dishes. I thought that was a nice touch. Their portions are huge, and taste excellent. We will definitely be back. VERY GOOD LUNCH !

Coming from Long Beach, Ca and living right near the ocean, I've always had the most fresh fish when it comes to my sushi.   I barely moved to AZ this past February. It took a while for me to find a good sushi restaurant. Being that we are in the middle of the desert, it was hard to find a place that served good tasting/fresh sushi until I came to Akai Hana. I've gone to both locations and both places had the most fresh tasting sushi. I always order the rainbow roll and it was very delicious here.   The staff was also very kind and attentive to their guests. Our waiter was always checking on us to make sure we didn't need anything. We didn't come during a slow period, so the staff is very on top of their customers.   Can't wait to go back for my weekly sushi date with my sister :)

We live in a town where we can't get sushi so when we travel we are always craving to find it. What an awesome restaurant with great food and ambience. My grandsons love sushi and we also enjoyed the sweet restaurant owner (?) who gave my boys some origami art pieces. We had delicious fresh made sushi and heartwarming service. Fun and good!

Service was very slow. The food was not appetizing. My rolls were sitting in a pool of oil and had an unpleasant hot sauce instead of eel sauce or even spicy mayo and mostly consisted of about 70% rice. Oily rice balls with hot sauce. Gross. Not what I think of when I crave a Las Vegas roll. Sushi Bros is much better.

My husband and I tried this place on a whim and it has become our favorite sushi restaurant in Phoenix. The happy hour prices are so inexpensive, so even if it wasn't the best quality it would still be worth it. However, we have been here at least half a dozen times, and each time we enjoy every roll we order. HIGHLY recommend this place to anyone looking for great sushi at a very fair price. :)

Might be the best hole-in-the-wall sushi in PHX (read: this is not your typical Scottsdale joint). Sashimi cuts are generous and fresh. The uni (sea urchin) was exceptional; it was creamy but not fishy, which is a testament to the quality of the seafood here. If you want to try a roll that'll blow your mind, get the Butter Me Up roll. I don't normally like cooked rolls, but this one is perfection. Nothing is bad, except personally, I like to avoid the spicy mayo rolls. Enjoy!!! If you like sushi, you won't be disappointed.

Price was great! Took a friend to lunch. He is a regular there... I'll try it again, but I wasn't wowed by the flavor. I got the lunch box (bento). presentation was nice. food wasn't bad, just wasn't my favorite. Next time I'll order something different.

This was a great find! My husband and I drove past it randomly and decided to stop in after seeing the other positive reviews. We weren't disappointed at all. I would recommend going during happy hour (from 4-6 and from 8-close). Better prices and a good selection even with the limited happy hour selections. But the normal sushi menu had probably 75 rolls or more to choose from. Will definitely be coming back.

This place is super fresh and priced just right! Lunch specials from 6.95 - 9.95! And every one worth the price charged. The place is packed at lunch so you should go only if you have an hour, otherwise I would suggest dinner or after work for happy hour! I recommend the sushi lunch special which is fresh and has a nice sampling of sushi with a wonderfully unique spicy salmon hand roll. Or the sashimi lunch special if you're avoiding the rice! If you're not into Sushi they serve a great teriyaki chicken special with a California roll, soup and a huge salad for only 6.95! All in all this is a great stop when you're craving fresh sushi at a great price! We will definitely return! Eat well, live well and enjoy!

The best sushi in the planet it's so awesome you will never be disappointed it gets crowded on the weekends and especially during happy hour they have a extremely large fan based and once you eat there you will know why. My sushi chef is the older mature asian male he is the most seasoned chef. Sit at the bar and get faster service it's cozy but a little cramped.

I am very picky when it comes to sushi and japanese cuisine. I have found one of the best sushi chefs in Phoenix. Sean, Tom, and the other sushi chefs really know how to be creative and provide great fresh sushi rolls. I see so many regulars talking to the chefs and saying that they will be back tomorrow.   You gotta try their spicy japanese dynamite salad, ceviche salad and their creative rolls.   You will not get enough of this goodness, I am from the islands and I know good fish/sushi!

I find the sushi here to be run-of-the-mill.   The I-17/Northern-adjacent strip mall restaurant is kind of quiet and subdued compared to the Scottsdale joints, and I like it that way.  I come here when I want something dependable in the central Phoenix area without driving clear out to Scottsdale.  The fish here for the most part is fresh - nothing too creative here, and the interior isn't much to crow about either.   I find the sushi here to be better than Zen 32 (and cheaper), but not quite at the caliber of other standout places in town.  P.S.  I find the name a little peculiar.  Mr. Sushi??  I would normally scoff at a place called Senor Taco, Ms. Pasta or Madame Hot Dog.  But for some reason I'm ok with the cheesy name.

Best Happy hour in phoenix! I can get about 6 rolls during happy hour for $35. They are delicious and larger than other places I have visited. The staff is great too, especially Sean, who has tons of fun with the customers.  The energy here is great. Their location is hidden in an empty strip mall, but their business is always booming, so that tells you just how amazing this place is. I will visit again soon!

I have been eating sushi for 10 years and this is the best place in the world.  They are known for their NUMBERS 1-10 (that is an insider's secret) in regards to the spicy factor.  Santos is not to be messed with.  You will often find him snickering at you from behind the sushi bar as sweat pours down your head.  He is a great sushi chef.  And don't let Ashino fool you with his quiet demeanor.  He is actually listening to every single word  you say!  Be careful how much sake you drink or he may just sneak a few drops of "death sauce" into your tuna handroll!  Haha!  yes, Mr. Sushi is the best.  Try "The Karen Roll" or if you are really wanting to make an impression, order the KSARGE roll which is NOT EVEN ON THE MENU!  Better yet, order PIGS IN THE BLANKET (Santos Style!).  Don't worry, he will know what to do!

First time visit to Akaihana.  Pleasantly surprised by the awesome sushi rolls.  Although the dragon roll was a bit squishy/runny in the middle which made it a bit unpleasant to eat.  Cali rolls and spicy tuna rolls were great tasting.  The fried calamari was not calamari...more like fried fish sticks (not exaggerating). Service was good, fast and very cordial.  The place could use booths.
Two favorite rolls are the Butter me Up and Blue Flame. Get a Shrimp Boat if your a little adventurous.

My girlfriend was craving some sushi and our regular place is closed on Sundays so a coworker of hers suggested this place.  Really disappointing.  While they have an extensive menu, there are lots of rolls that they have no description for.  Its frustrating to assume that everyone that comes in to your restaurant is a sushi expert or that they would have to sit there and ask what various rolls are.  My girlfriends sashimi came out and the fish were no where near as cold as you'd want raw fish to be and they used a ton of imitation crab in their hand rolls.  Basically left her with edamame and jalapeno poppers.  When jalapeno poppers are the best thing on a customers tab by a wide margin in a SUSHI restaurant, might want to get some new chefs in there.  I ordered somen noodles (which where pictured and looked nothing like the picture) teriyaki chicken (could have used another 30 seconds in the microwave or maybe less time in the window), rice and goyza (over priced, for the number of pieces you get, 5) and a cherry coke.    Ironically the cherry coke was REALLY good, i believe they used cherry syrup in addition to the coca-cola as opposed to the cherry coke that coca-cola company produces.  The service was pretty lacking, all in all not worth the drive and the happy hour on Sunday was enough to get us in there but I can't imagine returning.
Love this little place!! The Blue Flame roll was amazazing!! I loved the we were able to buy our own chopsticks.
Very good Sushi excellent happy hour prices our new close by sushi restaurant. The sushi rolls are large try the Rainbow roll the California rolls are good too.

Expensive AND bland. It was our first time here and, undoubtedly, our last. The miso soup had no flavor as did the sushi and tempura. I ordered a shrimp hand roll that I could not for the life of me figure out what it was!!! Incredibly bad food for inflated prices.

I have ate here in the past, and they did a great job on lunch today. Service was fast, people were friendly, food was good. Nothing too stellar about this establishment, everything is the way it should be.  The reason I gave three stars was that my rolls kept falling apart when I picked them up with the chop sticks, it was very hard to manage and then a section would fall out and I had to scoop it up.  The cucumber salad is different and with long shredded strands of cucumber and a nice sesame sprinkle a light vinegar dressing. I did nothing out the ordinary on the rolls as i ordered from the Happy Hour specials - great prices BTW!  Its a decent place to try, so swing by if you have a craving.

A friend and I drove over to the other side of town to try Mr. Sushi, per the recommendation of her brother.  We waited twenty minutes for the waiter to come to our table.  Then it took an hour and twenty more minutes to get the food.  By the time the sushi arrived, we were starving.  The presentation was excellent, and I was anticipating some excellent sushi goodness.  Wrong.  I looked at my friend and said, "this tastes like it came out of the LA River."  She agreed.  We paid the bill and left most of the food still on the plates.  It was completely unpalatable.  What a disappointment.
This is my favorite sushi place! I've tried other ones but nothing beats this one! It's delicious and so inexpensive! You can get a great deal here for an amazing meal!

I am a sushi -a - holic.  The food was FANTASTIC.  I was in town for the Pro Bowl and came across this restaurant, which is hidden, because it was just outside my hotel room.  Went on a Friday night around 8P.  The service, not so good, but the food was amazing!!!!  The best oysters on the half shell I've had since I left Florida years ago.  The wild salmon roll was out of this world.  It's a shame I don't think I'll be returning to Phoenix.  I'd be a regular at Akaihana Sushi!!

This is one of the best places in the west valley if not the entire valley to get sushi!  They changed the name but the location is the same.  I was looking for sushi on Sherpa and came across this well reviewed place.  Man am I glad!  I had talked a friend into trying sushi one more time (the first time was at a place in Sedona my mistake!).  We ordered the Hollywood roll - SWEET LORD was it good my friend said it was one of the best foods he ever had never mind the sushi part it was just that good.  We also tried the Hannah roll which was very good as well!  Please support this place, so many places are disappearing in Phx due to the economy and its hard enough to find Good food in Phx let alone this great!  If you use Sherpa or a I phone ap please review its what helped me find this place!  I usually won't try a unreviewed place as food is usually poor quailty in Phx.

A wonderful experience coming into the door, fresh sushi, and different combinations make this one of our faves.  That spicy tuna cracker was the best thing we have ever eaten here, ever . In the 6 years we have been coming.   The music is awesome. Come here.

My friend found this spot and I would definitely return. The location is kind of odd because it's right by the freeway and we missed the entrance because it was dark. The restaurant was charming and had Japanese decor. The fish tasted fresh and the pieces were large! I was slowing down toward the end of my meal. You get your bang for your buck. The special I had with nigiri, hand roll and spicy tuna roll plus a sashimi salad was about $13-15. There were a lot of people dining in. I'm looking forward to going back here next time I'm in town.

I was afraid to try sushi in Arizona. Its just this thing I have with a place not being that close to the ocean and selling raw fish. Its an equation in my head that doesn't make sense.   My uncle really wanted sushi and wanted to take me to his favorite place. Being this place. We showed up ten minutes before they closed. I felt so bad because I hated that when I worked in retail and just wanted to close up my store and someone would walk in two minutes till closing. That sometimes is bad too because you may get the remnants of what was good earlier that day and isn't anymore.   We promised to be fast and we ordered really fast and the food was on our table really fast. We devoured our meal with delight. The rolls were so good. Some of the best sushi I have had. I cant remember what I bought but everything was good. Even the spicy stuff I tried. I don't normally eat the spicy stuff but this stuff was really good. My uncle was right about this place. I left a good tip too because we were there late.

Oh Akai Hana. Why are you so far away. I wish I could take you in my pocket and bring you back to Tempe. (lol creepy.)  Boyfriend and I made the 26 minute trek to check out Akai Hana's reverse happy hour menu. I remember the time because I WAS SO HUNGRY AND EXCITED.   Service wasn't crazy fast, but not as stupid long as Sushi Kee in Tempe. (You should avoid Sushi Kee Tempe at all costs. You have been warned.)  But oh my god, when the rolls came out.. they were GENEROUS with the fish, and the rolls were BIG.  Would I come back to Akai Hana with Mido Sushi just around the corner? ...I might. It's definitely in the realm of possibility.  If you are in the area and can make Akai Hana's reverse happy hour (8pm onwards) - I URGE YOU TO CHECK IT OUT.  My party of two got six rolls for $40, including tip.

What a truly great find.      One Sunday my g/f did a search on her phone for Sunday happy hours,  first on the google list was this place from 3-6 and 8-9 on Sundays they have a great sushi happy hour.    Don't let your first impressions fool you, it's not in a great neighborhood (and by that I mean its not 'bad', just not great).   They seem to be the only surviving place in the strip mall just about Northern on I17.   I usually won't go to a new sushi place on a Sunday because of the freshness of the fish etc... but it turned out to be a great place and fantastic food and the price was a SUPERB DEAL!  We went in, place only had about 12 people in it at that time.  Staff were very friendly, polite, quick to bring menus, drinks etc.   We ordered Edamame, calamari, and 6 rolls.   We are still not sure why we ordered 6, but the prices were so low we assumed they would be smaller portions like you get at other happy hours.  WRONG  We had so much food we ended up setting up a buffet on the next table!   Apart from the Tropicana roll, which had some weird apricot gel on it... everything was seriously good!  Vegas roll, California, spicy tuna, caterpillar, spicy salmon & Tropicana+ 2 ice teas and 2 appetizers, under $40.     Great find.  We were going to go again but we missed the happy hour deadline.

Never going back.  When we got there, we were like "wait, is this Mr. Sushi? or Akaihana Sushi?" since the restaurant has both names in front.  When you go in, you see the sushi counter with one Japanese chef and rest, Mexican chefs.  They seated us at the very back corner where it was pretty dark.....it was so dark that we had to squint our eyes to see the menu.  There were screaming kids, squeaking fans all over and waitresses having fun chatting.  The food...omg, it's as bad as Ra.  We ordered combination plate b., i., and "mistake" roll.  Believe me they are all BAD....afterwards, I got a tummy ache......sigh.  *Ambiance = dark, low-class *Service = if you like your waitresses having fun chatting about their relationships and stuff, yeah you will like it *Food = .....BAD -beef teriyaki = TOUGH -sashimi = it's interesting how a Japanese person can serve that proudly and call it sashimi. -california roll = we usually do our best to finish the plate but it was just not possible. -tempura = ok overall but they definitely use OLD oil -rice = cheap rice for sure.

My favorite sushi place.  I've been frequenting this place for the last 4 years.  Their hot green tea is strong and hot just the way I like it. This place has the best rainbow roll. The rainbow roll and crunchy California roll are a must. The service is good and they've recently remodeled. The place looks good.
Tonight was very delicious. We both had bento type boxes and the food was nice and fresh. Kirin light to top it off. Very good.

I love this place.  I know the name "Mr. Sushi" sounds corny and you're thinking I'm not eating sushi in a strip mall but you're just missing out.  These guys make the best sushi in town.  It's always fresh, they have a menu thats like a novel.  I always try a new roll when I go and I never leave disappointed and always bloated.  It's hard to stop when it's this good.  The atmosphere is nothing special but you can tell it's good by the local following and business crowd they attract.  Sit at the bar if available and watch the show.  It may seem out of the way especially for you east siders but round up some friends and make the drive:  Its worth it!!!!!

Server was friendly, we didn't get our drinks for about 10-15 mins but it was very busy so I wasn't mad about it. Not a lot of space to move around in there, it's very cramped when busy. But the sushi was excellent, the seaweed salad was great. The menu is huge so I will be back!

Good place for the west side.. Nestled inside the chasm of a very non descript strip mall off the beaten sunny slope path on Northern and the 17 Freeway..   I looked to it as a hidden sushi island .. hidden away from the world for me to discover... So I discovered.. and here is my report..  O.k. happy hour.. A couple of names Mr Sushi or Akaihana which I think means "red flower". Reading other peoples reviews going back I guess it has had a few names? ..  Anyway ..Its a good lunch and quick drink place. not much else I am pretty certain of.  I have eaten here twice now and I am glad I did before reviewing it. tonight's subsequent visit has served as a more complete look at the place.  The first time I ate there I ended up sitting next to the owner by total coincidence. It was he who guided me to the specialty hand rolls. I had the lobster the butter me up and a few others that he recommended. I would give that experience 4 stars.  This time however... unfortunately for me was not quite the experience of the previous one :{ The happy hour was crowded Tonight so it took a while to get any service.. I sat there for a good 10 min before getting my beer. Whatever it was busy..but I had to wait 5 min for them to even look at me when I walked in the door. Sorta annoying..  The fish was not that fresh and I guess I would expect it to be on a Friday? I had just a simple dragon roll and the thing fell apart trying to eat it. The squid salad was o.k... All for about 20$ with a sake bomber The experience was a 2 star one..  I gotta give them credit that some of the special rolls are pretty tasty. The rest was just average .. and the service this time was pretty painful.  Everyone I have ever talked to in the place has told me it was their favorite..There seems to be good local following... and the place was packed for the new happy hour, so maybe I just got the "raw" end of the deal this time?..  You will want this place to go if your in the neighborhood and certainly go to it for the rolls to at least try em,, but my Yelp app will be primed for a new place the next time I am on the west side.

My girlfriend and i come here whenever we're craving sushi (which is very often) and we love this place. The people are really friendly and the sushi is the best we've had so far. Surprisingly its very cheap; If you're ever in the area i strongly recommend stopping by.

This is now my new go to sushi place, it's so good!! They have a great happy hour menu with so many options. My boyfriend and I went for the first time last week and have already gone back a couple of times since then! I am a vegan but they have so many choices- I have ordered the cucumber avocado roll, cucumber roll and my favorite is the kampyo roll made with sweet gourd. My boyfriends favorites have been the blue flame roll, tootsie roll, and the fried California roll. We love the food and the prices and we will continue to come back!! I definitely would recommend giving this place a try!

Be prepared to look over the menu for a while. It's the cheescake factory is sushi rolls. I have only tried 7 rolls here but they were all very good. It's worth the trip to make it to this small but abondant specialty rolls restaurant.
Tried a new five alarm chili. It was nice and hot. Spicy shrimp  roll was great.  Even their California  roll is  very good. Place was hopping  . They are reasonably  priced . We like this place

Major points to this sushi restaurant for coming up with creative variations that work. For instance, who else would have thought that fresh tomato could make a delightfully fresh and tasty roll (the Summer Tomato Roll, to be specific)? But it makes sense, as tomato is one of the best natural sources of glutamate, the umami element. The other rolls we had were equally satisfying. The large dining area with contemporary vibe, the superb sushi, and prices that are really good for the quality and quantity of the food explain the popularity of this sushi restaurant.

Best sushi and best price in town! I usually come on Saturdays and get the lunch sushi special and one roll off the happy hour menu. Been coming here for years. The fish is always delicious and the service is friendly. They recently renovated inside and it looks trendy and upscale without being overpriced. This place is always busy and that's for a good reason! Come here and you won't be disappointed.

A nice find in a unassuming Location. Came on a Monday night and the place was decently busy. I ordered the jalapeño poppers and a few rolls. the jalapeño poppers were good, not too spicy. Fish tasted fresh and the veggies too!

Good quality sushi with a good variety of specialty rolls. The prices, both happy hour and normal, are pretty affordable. This place gets extremely busy though, so expect to wait a bit for your food (both take out and sit down). The have a little room off to the side for bigger parties which is a nice touch.

Stumbled upon this great restaurant by accident. It's hidden at the back of a strip center and very hard to see. Fabulous service with amazing lunch specials. Everything we ordered was delicious! We will be back.

I've been trying to find a good sushi spot since I moved to the Glendale/Phoenix area and this is my favorite out of the ones I've been to so far. They have a huge selection of sushi and each dish is unique and delicious. However, my only complaint so far is that their udon did not meet my expectations. But, I'll keep coming back just so I can try the whole sushi menu!
I love this little spot! Great food & good service and the prices are so reasonable! I'd eat here every day if I could. Their Tropicana roll is my wife's absolute favorite.

Best. Sushi. Ever. A little bit of a drive but my family has been going here for 10 years. It's always fresh, delicious & there is a huge varieties of rolls. I wish it was closer so I could visit more often. If you're in the area don't pass it up.

I was not A sushi person until I came here. They have cooked sushi (blue flame roll) freakin amazing. Clean and always busy. The service is good and it's not that expensive. Good sake, cute decor. Highly recommend this place. Never have had a bad meal and it turned me on to sushi, huge diverse menu.

Went here for lunch and was good.  Sushi special for $9 included 2 classics, the spicy tuna roll and california roll, plus Tuna, Salmon, White fish and Crab.  Miso Soup and Salad too.  Yes, it was a lot for a lunch!  I will be back again to enjoy lunch and try their other varieties.  Would recommend this spot for anyone looking to try sushi or the savvy sushi buyer.  Nice setting and friendly service.

The sushi here is fantastic and judging by the Saturday night dinner crow, I was not alone in that opinion.  We had a number of rolls, I wish I could remember them all now but they were all fabulous.  My only complaint is that the service is very slow.  Our waitress brought us waters and disappeared for about 20 minutes.  I had to flag her down to place our order and to get the check.  However despite that I would definitely go back.

I brought my girlfriend her for her birthday. The place is really busy but parking was not a problem. It was a bit noisy. They have a some nice boat dishes that look cool in presentation.  There does not seem like anything special is around this restaurant so it stands alone to me.   The service is friendly but is too busy and has some language road bumps but they did keep the place neat and clean.   The price was typical for most sushi places I have been too however, they did not have an all you can eat option.  The best part of the meal was the desert that was not on the main menu. I thought that it was ridiculous that they would leave it off. I saw others with the ice cream tempura on their table and I wanted it too. Since the sushi takes 15 plus minutes after ordering I ordered the ice cream first. It was totally worth it, it was beautiful and fun!  The hollywood roll was my favorite but the eel roll, which is my standard, was not what I thought it would be. Only some of the rolls were great. (Hollywood and ice cream tempura, however your mileage may vary - ymmv).  If it was convenient I might try it again for happy hour.

Yummy sushi! I definitely recommend coming in and trying the crazy roll (pictured)! The portions are large and the food is delicious! The staff is friendly and authentically Japanese-family owned and run!
Not too far from my work.  Average sushi with abundant selection of hand rolls.

After getting into a discussion with a coworker about the merits of spending large amounts of money on single Japanese dinners, a craving for sushi set in.  I didn't think there were any good sushi bars nearby work, but considering we were just having lunch, I was OK with average sushi for this occasion.  The reviews for this place were middling, but the photos painted a different picture, so we gave it a shot.  We rolled up to the place, and found an empty business park, except for this one restaurant set back from the main road.  Definitely a hole-in-the-wall, and not a location the hipsters and yuppies will be flocking anytime soon.  We sat down at the bar, and noticed a wall plastered with different specials.  Some rolls, some not rolls, some frog legs, some soups, etc.  A complete olio of handwritten dishes, some of which may have been up there for ages for all I could tell.  I ordered an assortment of sushi, the grilled hamachi kama, the ankimo (any place that serves ankimo is automatically above average), a bluefin toro hand roll (not on the menu, but I asked the chef to make me one), and an uni shooter.  As the sushi arrived, it became clear to me that the chef actually knew what he was doing.  He was an older Japanese gentleman with a hard-to-decipher accent, and clearly he was trained in the art of traditional sushi.  The sushi was properly garnished such that I didn't have to use soy sauce on but one or two items, the rice properly melted in my mouth, and the meal was properly paced.  Those who prefer their sushi Americanized and doused in wasabi may not find this place to be anything special, due to its lack of "scene."  But as a fan of traditional sushi, I would say this is one of the top three places I have found in the Phoenix area. And to think I had worked less than a mile away for nine months without knowing about it!

Also and formerly known as "Mr. Sushi."  This is the first place I ever tried real "raw" sushi.  I was probably about 13 years old when my parents introduced me to Mr. Sushi and I had only ever tried a california roll before.  Well Akai Hana opened my mind to so many other varities of sushi.  I fell in love with tuna :)   They also serve hot dishes and bento boxes. Very authentic with a variety of seafood, good prices and happy hour all of the time until 5pm and after 8pm-9/10pm depending on the day of the week.  My favorite happy hour rolls are the blue flame, spicy tuna hand roll, and the tuna roll.  This is probably my favorite sushi place of all time.  My family and I have spent almost every birthday here since I we have been coming here together for about 15 years.  On birthdays the sushi chefs will  make a special roll for you or bring out green tea ice cream with a candle in it and take a couple of polaroid pix for their wall and one for you to take home.  You can also call and request there special room for a more intimate time with a larger party of people.  I highly recommend giving this place a shot-you will have a great experience from the moment you walk in when the sushi chefs personally greet to the moment you leave with a belly full of sushi :)

I wish I liked Akai Hana, as they have all the items that I would look for in a Japanese restaurant. The prices are definitely affordable too. Came in during happy hour and had a spicy salmon roll, seaweed salad, soft shell crab and shumai. The roll was made out of rice that was overcooked and the pieces all fell apart. Seaweed salad and shumai were nothing special. The soft shell crab was a tiny piece of crab for $6. It was the best thing I had among everything I ordered, but I wish they added a little more breading. Over all, this place just isn't for me. Service wasn't great, my water was never refilled and I felt like I was bothering my server.   I do know a couple of people who frequent this place and swear that this is the best Japanese restaurant in Arizona. I would still recommend you to try it; maybe I just came at the wrong time.

I've had sushi twice in Arizona and I think that dallas just has better sushi.  The prices were phenomenal here during happy hour.  The sushi just wasn't that great. Ive had way better in Dallas.  One of our rolls had crab in it and my friend are a piece and ended up finding a piece of shell in her food.  It made her turned off by eating anything else so she couldn't even finish her lunch.  The waitress was kind enough to not charge us for it but this spot kind of ruined sushi for me for some time.

Sushi A No No  I came for the lunch happy hour specialsand was impressed with the pricing. I managed to get three rolls for under $15. My friends were able to get the Bento box and sushi special for under $10 each.  My main dishes or the spicy tuna roll, the blue flame roll, and the salmon skin roll.  Best roll was the blue flame roll. It is very reminiscent of a Las Vegas roll but without the cream cheese. It is not spicy at all despite the warnings. Very heavy roll due to it being fried 3.5/5  Spicy tuna roll is not spicy at all. The fish quality is not very high either. Very forgettable. 3/5  The worst roll is the salmon skin roll. I have ordered this dish from other restaurants before but this is the worst iteration I have ever tasted. The salmon is over cooked, and honestly reminds me of salmon from a can. You can't taste any crispy salmon skin. Unedible. Normally I don't waste food but I could not eat more than one piece. 1/5.
The happy hour is very reasonable and the service is always on point. My favorite roll is the Blue Flame by far. I definitely recommend!

Mmmmmmr. Sushi!   This was the place I lost my sushi virginity to, and the place responsible to getting me hooked!   I love the location, right off of the freeway, as if it were a sushi pit stop! The best part of this place is it's very low key and casual. A comforting place to pig out on sushi. The sushi is very authentic which is rare in an over-sushied city. Each roll is beyond delicious and made to perfection. This place is underrated. Grade A rolls at a low key location? Awesome!!  The service is also very speedy, hooray! This is a perfect place for a quick lunch.  I'm still a huge Mr. Sushi fan after so many years. Four stars!

I remember when AkaiHana was called Mr. Sushi and am beyond pleased that the quality of the sushi remains top notch!  I decided to bring an out of town guest since his sushi experience prior was limited to sushi buffets. He loved sitting at the bar and watching our rolls being prepped.   Our sushi chef, Jack, was quiet, but amicably responded to any of our questions after he announced each of our rolls as they were ready. He even gave a free sample of sashimi!   My friend's favorite roll was the Tootsie Roll because of the crunch and sweet sauce.  My favorite was the Butter Me Up ... Garlic butter with a hint of wasabi topped with seared salmon!   I also enjoy the remodeled open concept space.    I will definitely be back!  Side Note: "Who Says" by Selena Gomez played in the background ... Her music is one of my guilty pleasures.:)

I've been going to Mr Sushi for the past 5 yrs. They are actually open for lunch on Saturdays. They have the best lunch specials and my favorite rolls i order are the Mexican and New York roll. Love their salad dressing and all the different appetizers.   The only complaint i have about this place is that sometimes they will have a all you can eat night and of course on those nights the place gets packed. They do not seem to have enough staff to accommodate such a large number of customers on those nights. They need better planning on those nights. We must have waited at least 30 minutes just to order.

Awesome sushi selection and sushi for sure!!!  Happy hour even better, and they have happy hour on weekends as well!  Service sucks, so dont go there super hungry, order appy as soon as you sit down.  But so worth the wait.
The sushi seemed pretty over priced, and I am not sure, but I think that both my friend and I got food poisoning from this place.

I love Akihana! This is hands down my favorite sushi place in Phoenix. They have an amazing selection of sushi rolls and a wide variety of extras to try out - luke the frog legs (give em a try, you won't be sorry). The service is great and the bar tenders are hilarious! Try a panty dropper - it's a martini with sea urchins in it, unless you got shit to do later, it will mess you up!

I got the blue flame roll (mainly crab) and the manhattan roll (shrimp+raw salmon) Blue flame--- 6/10 (its kinda confusing, you cant really tell what you are eating) Manhattan---- 10/10 (this one is really good... definitely recommending it to everyone)  My sister got the combo shrimp tempura with sashimi and vege salad... the tempura was okey. The sessame salad with their dressing was amazing! (Get anything with the salad and dressing)  I would give this a 4 star if only we had better service during the dinner. This is one of the slowest japanese place i ever had. I think it was mainly because of our server. The other servers were swift so i guess i cannot generalize the whole place with poor service. They have a lot of choices for their rolls so i still want to comeback and try the others!  So should you...  :P

I'm from Los Angeles. I've been to many, many sushi restaurants.   I'm visiting my uncle in Phoenix, decide to try the place next door to my hotel.   AMAZING. hands down the best sushi I have ever had... GET THE LAS VEGAS ROLL!!! You will immediately evolve into a dashingly handsome full grown Charizard, after eating this evolution stone called sushi.  You will literally become the President of Your mom after eating here.  You will go home satisfied and ready to fight the war on terrorism.

This is the second time I've been here and the first time I was able to actually try the food. 1st time I came and waited an hour and didn't even get my food before I had to return to work.  Second time sat at the sushi bar and it was ok. Got a spicy tuna and Tropicana roll. Wasn't impressed by the sushi at all. Glad I only paid $10  Probably won't be back. Not worth the wait

Great food, HORRIBLE service. I've been coming here for a while and I love their rolls! However, the last few times I've come it's taken close to 30 minutes to get seated and hours to receive our order... overall really disorganized and hectic. Doesn't seem like the staff communicates...

I'm fairly new to the world of Sushi, yesterday I came to Mr. Sushi with some coworkers and we ordered a variety of rolls.  I started with my "go to" California rolls, and tried for the first time some Vegas rolls, and some other rolls of which the names escape me right now.  It was all pretty good, I'm sure there is better out there but on this day I left with my Sushi craving satisfied.
Excellent sushi and sashimi etc. great little place in northern Phoenix. Authentic sushi chefs, great quality food. Big sushi bar.  Highly recommended.

I am not a fan of eating raw fish, but this restaurant always satisfies me with its extended cooked food menu, especially its appetizers. It's almost five star for the food, service, and prices. Tried lots of different items. Everything is up to expectations except for the Sukiyaki. The Sukiyaki was served appealing and tasted good. however, the beef was hand-cut into very thick pieces and too chewy. Wish the chef could improve it by slicing the beef thinner next time.

**Best sushi in ALL of Phoenix** I frequent this place very regularly and I never get tired of eating it. They have a huge variety of choices to choose from, so you'll never bore. Variety range from vegetarian/vegan rolls to meaty rolls and even low carb rolls. Staff is always friendly and very helpful. Each sushi chef has his own unique style/flare and it is definitely represented in their cooking. Granted all the chefs cooking AMAZINGLY, my family and I have our favorite chef named Sean while my friends have their favorite chef named Hero. You take your pick lol! I would 1000% recommend this place.

Food was awesome!  Prices were even better,.  Salmon skin roll was the best I've had.  Wait staff SUCKS!  Cute college girls that are DUMB!  Don't bother asking any questions.  When I go back, I'll sit at the sushi bar!!  The place is small and quaint.  Clean..  I saw a couple get up and leave due to no service.
Food was great, Servers were attentive and very nice. They have a large menu with some great dishes that I haven't had since visiting Japan!  I will definitely come back next time I'm in Phoenix.
A young lady named kiokiri-sorry if I spelled it wrong-was super attentive and great service from her.   Anyways, great sushi selection and beverages. Thanks again kiokiri.

AAAAMMMMMMAAAAZZZZINNNNNGGGG! I have been going here for about 3 years now and I've never been disappointed. The service is always amazing and the food is delicious, not to mention cheap! They know me by name and I even have my own chopsticks in house!   It is small and can get busy on Fridays but I promise you it is worth the wait!  I recommend my favorite, The Mexican Roll (Tuna, cucumber, and Habanero) it's spicy! To cool things down Billy super tuna!   Give it a try, this place beats any other any day of the week.
We went here for lunch while waiting for a Bookman's order and were pleasantly surprised! Great lunch specials and lovely service. Blue Flame roll was awesome

Mr. Sushi has a awesome happy hour. Service is always mediocre to sub par... So sit at the bar vs a table. Good rolls.. Interesting rolls... Not great rolls...good prices..and friendly staff behind the sushi bar..
Love hole in the wall joints like this.  Great sushi plus a nice complete menu of Japanese faves.  Always a favorite.  Its our neighborhood go to spot for sushi and drinks.

Some of the best sushi for an affordable price! I have been coming here fairly often since discovering this little mom and pop place a couple years ago. I have never had to wait an extensive period of time for my food, in fact, theyre so quick, that ive been like "hold on, i have my other rolls to eat!" Every person that i have taken here has been somewhat of a sushi snob and they have raved about this place. everything is fresh and affordable, you can have a full meal, leaving you stuff and hating your growing belly for less than 20 bucks (providing that you take part in Happy Hour, which is phenomenal pricing!) otherwise without HH, the prices are still quite good. Now i know there are 2 locations and im not sure which one of the locations these negative reviewers went to, but i frequent the location on i-17 and Northern and THIS location is amaze-balls.

I've been going to this place for years. I actually went on my first date with my current partner here. It's a bit nostalgic for me.  The happy hour is great! They make a TON of different rolls and they do them well and the fish is very fresh. The chef is excellent and friendly.  The Vegas roll is unlike any Vegas roll you've had before. Give it a try.  The Mexican roll....holy smokes! I swear they put a whole habanero into it. I thought I was going to die! Be careful with this one...  I've never had anything but the sushi in here so I cannot comment on anything else.  Give it a try and make sure you get a lot!  Oh, and try the lobster or scallop dynamite....it is DYNAMITE!!!

This is my favorite Sushi place in all of Phoenix Metro.  Shawn the General Manger is always helpful and how he remembers people who come in by name is a crazy skill.  The remodeled so there is twice the seating that was there before and they added a bar.  I gladly drive from Mesa up to Phoenix just to have Sushi there.  It's worth the drive and the prices during happy hour are the best of any place I have been too.  Yes, its a 5 star rating, It's always been top quality.
Great sushi! Had the Blue Flame roll and loved it! Very popular neighborhood sushi bar with friendly and efficient staff. We will definitely go again!
This place has amazing Sushi, the owner is funny as $hi+ and always welcomes us. Happened to come here on a friends recommendation, Mr.Sushi roll is off the charts.

Prices moderate, large selection of sushi.  But a majority of sushi had imitation crab stick or crab salad. I don't like either and had to look at menu closely to make sure it didn't have those on it. The sushi that I had was good. Although most Sushi came in a soy sauce bath which I could have done without. But Sushi was fresh yummy and served promptly. I see reviews mentioning appetizers but I do not see any appetizers mentioned on the menu. Wait staff did not offer refills on soda and we're not really involved with customers. The people who are making sushi delivered sushi but I was sitting at the bar so that may be different at a table. Not sure if I would return with a moderate prices and imitation crab . I did ask about price difference with adding real crab and it was around $6 per roll which is expensive compared to other places.

Service is friendly, environment is laid back. Knocked a few stars for pricing and flavor. The surf&turf roll is beyond the saltiest roll I have ever tasted. The salt overpowered the garlic and the meat on top was bland! How?! They used smoked salmon instead of fresh salmon for my philly roll... not cool. Rainbow roll was ok. Nothing to rave about though. The only lovely part of the meal was the salmon sashimi. It was delicious. Other than that I'm unimpressed.
Nice place, good food, good service. I arrived during happy hour and gorged on good sushi.

Hidden gem - tucked away in a non descript strip shopping center, I almost missed it!  I'm glad I didn't - freshly made, great service, and reasonably priced.  Huge selection of sushi - you won't be disappointed!

This is a cute little family owned place with great food for a great price (especially during happy hour/reverse happy hour). I like the teriyaki chicken dinner plate, the Yaki Soba, the caterpillar roll and the classic rainbow roll.

Reasonable prices, tasty food, friendly service, and near my house.    Can't ask for more than that, really.    Lots of variety, both dining room seating and bar seating (where you can watch the guys make your sushi up close) and great lunch and happy hour specials.  Just go and see for yourself.

Best Ever,  we go as much as we can.   Impeccable food,  service could use some coaching but you hardly care when the food arrives and almost forget when the check comes,  it is so inexpensive!!!!  This place is always packed,  and for good reason.
Best Sushi. For people who like to eat real sushi. Down to earth good food. Not pretentious like other sushi places that offer a 'scene'.   Now with Takoyaki!
Pricey sushi but its WORTH IT. Normally when I want a quick fix I hit up cheaper places but when I'm in the mood for great sushi with a friend, I go to Akaihana.

Good relatively cheap sushi, although all of the sushi has the same crab salad filling. It's not the highest quality but good. Got the fried cali rolls and they were a decent 8 ish rolls for 6 bucks.  Can't complain for the price.  3 stars only because the filling is literally the same for everything and it all kind of tastes the same.  But it's cheap and easy so I would still recommend it.
Best sushi in phx for the best price. Ra? Stingray? Why bother... Save your money and still get the best quality sushi. Happy hour is a must. I go every Tuesday.
This is a great little sushi spot! Sever was awesome and food was amazing! My FAMILY and I will be coming back most definitely!!

I flippin' love this place. Love I love the chaotic menus (which are posted all over the walls) I love that they have fresh wasabi I love that they have frogs legs  I only wish it were closer to my house.
Good Sushi place, actually one of my favorite places to eat sushi because it's convenient located off I17 and Northern close to home.  The service is always good and the food always fresh.

I come to Akaihana a lot. Like far more than I probably should given it's almost the opposite end of town for me. There a couple reasons I come here but the key ones are fair prices and good sushi. The others are it's a nice central meeting spot for my buddies and I and also right by my girlfriends work.  When I come here 9 out of 10 times I am ordering the Sushi Special ($13) which is a cali roll, 5 pieces of nigiri, a spicy salmon hand roll, miso soup and their special salad.
